Comments_List: I broad, integrative understanding of liberal education.

This class requires you to think critically about what the real purpose of higher education is, and at times it's a bit meta because as you are discussing skills and values you should have as liberally educated human, Professor Hersh is also trying to instill them in you. This is a writing credit, so clarity of thought and argument are important skills taught in the class. Professor Hersh cares deeply for his students and they're development as thinkers and writers, so he would give feedback n a draft as many times as you turned it in. If you wanted to rewrite your paper 7 times, he would have spent the time to revise it 7 times until you were happy with it.
Take this class if you're at all interested in liberal education, thinking more deeply about your own education, or just plain writing better.
